title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the District Court Districts and Areas
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the District Court Districts and Areas 
(Amendment) and Variation of Days and Hours (Nenagh, Thurles) No. 3. 
Order, 2024 
This Order shall come into operation on 15th April 2024
text_norm: 1 order may cited district court district area (amendment) variation day hour (nenagh thurles) no 3 order 2024 order shall come operation 15th april 2024

title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: 2. The First Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 ( S.I. No. 5
text_raw:
2. The First Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 ( S.I. No. 5 

of 1961 ), is hereby amended by— 

the substitution at reference number 233 for the matter in column (4) of the 
following: 

“Nenagh — Third and Fourth Monday in each month. Third Tuesday in 
each month. Third Wednesday in each month. First, Second, Third and 
Fourth Thursday in each month. First, Second, and Third Friday in each 
month. All sittings at 10.30 a.m.”, and 

the substitution at reference number 238 for the matter in column (4) of the 
following: 

“Thurles — First, Second, Third and Fourth Tuesday in each month. 
Third Wednesday in each month. Third Friday in each month. All 
sittings at 10.30 a.m.”
text_norm: 2 first schedule district court (areas) order 1961 ( s.i no 5 1961 ) hereby amended by-- substitution reference number 233 matter column (4) following nenagh -- third fourth monday month third tuesday month third wednesday month first second third fourth thursday month first second third friday month sitting 10.30 a.m substitution reference number 238 matter column (4) following thurles -- first second third fourth tuesday month third wednesday month third friday month sitting 10.30 a.m

title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: 3. The Second Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 (S.I.
text_raw:
3. The Second Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 (S.I. 

No. 5 of 1961), is hereby amended by— 

the substitution at reference number 201 for the matter in column (4) of the 
following: 

“Nenagh — Third and Fourth Monday in each month. Third Tuesday in 
each month. Third Wednesday in each month. First, Second, Third and 
Fourth Thursday in each month. First, Second, and Third Friday in each 
month. All sittings at 10.30 a.m.”, and 

the substitution at reference number 204 for the matter in column (4) of the 
following: 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 16th April, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [149] 3 

“Thurles — First, Second, Third and Fourth Tuesday in each month. 
Third Wednesday in each month. Third Friday in each month. All sittings 
at 10.30 a.m.”
text_norm: 3 second schedule district court (areas) order 1961 (s.i no 5 1961) hereby amended by-- substitution reference number 201 matter column (4) following nenagh -- third fourth monday month third tuesday month third wednesday month first second third fourth thursday month first second third friday month sitting 10.30 a.m substitution reference number 204 matter column (4) following notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 16th april 2024 149 3 thurles -- first second third fourth tuesday month third wednesday month third friday month sitting 10.30 a.m

title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: 4. Business transacted in the District Court that is initiated and not
text_raw:
4. Business transacted in the District Court that is initiated and not 
completed before commencement of this Order shall be continued and 
completed as if this Order had been in force at the time at which such business 
had been initiated. 

GIVEN under the Seal of the Courts Service, 

11 April, 2024. 

PAUL KELLY, 

Member of the Board of the Courts Service 
authorised to sign documents under the Seal of 
the Courts Service. 

LISA SCOTT, 

Officer of the Courts Service designated for the purpose of 
authenticating the Seal of the Courts Service, pursuant to 
section 10 of the Courts Service Act 1998. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [149]

title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order provides for the variation of Days at Nenagh and Thurles. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [149] 5
